Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) on family health insurance premiums by stating that they are "$2,600 less" on average than they would have been without it.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that family health insurance premiums would have continued to rise at the same pace before Obamacare.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Affordable Care Act is solely responsible for the decrease in family health insurance premiums, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the trend.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the decrease in family health insurance premiums, such as changes in the healthcare market or other policy interventions, which are not addressed in the claim.
